oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Wool CARDING. THE Subscribers hare erected a FINE WOOL-CARDING MACHINE, 6 1-2 miles East of Knoxville, on the main stage road, and are now prepared to card all kinds of Wool,. at the usual prices. The machine is new and of the best description, an inducement, certainly, for those wishing their Wool carded in good style to give it a trial.— It shall be our endeavor to give satisfaction to all, and all orders will be attended to forthwith. The Machine will be superintended by an experienced and careful hand, and such articles as are usually taken in exchange for Wool-Carding will be received by us. ROBERT ARMSTRONG. ADDISON W. ARMSTRONG. April, 1843, Printed at the Register Office, Knoxville.
